calorie: Track your calorie intake using a reliable app or journal.
Eat more vegetables to feel fuller on fewer calories.
Opt for lean proteins like chicken breast and fish.
Use smaller plates to help control portion sizes.
Drink water before meals to reduce hunger.
Snack on low-calorie, high-fiber foods like carrots or air-popped popcorn.
Limit sugary drinks and opt for unsweetened beverages.
protein: Include a source of protein in every meal, such as eggs, tofu, or legumes.
Use protein shakes or bars to supplement your intake.
Choose Greek yogurt over regular yogurt for higher protein content.
Snack on protein-rich options like nuts, seeds, or hard-boiled eggs.
Cook with protein-rich grains like quinoa or farro.
Combine plant proteins like beans and rice for a complete protein source.
Prioritize lean meats and seafood to avoid excessive saturated fats.
keto: Focus on high-fat, low-carb foods like avocado, cheese, and olive oil.
Replace starchy sides with cauliflower rice or zucchini noodles.
Choose fatty cuts of meat like ribeye steak and pork belly.
Avoid sugary fruits and opt for berries in moderation.
Use full-fat dairy products instead of low-fat options.
Incorporate healthy fats from nuts, seeds, and coconut oil.
Be mindful of hidden carbs in sauces, dressings, and processed foods.
general_tips: Drink at least 8 cups of water daily to stay hydrated.
Eat a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables for diverse nutrients.
Plan meals ahead to avoid impulsive unhealthy choices.
Limit processed foods and prioritize whole foods.
Chew food slowly to improve digestion and reduce overeating.
Balance macronutrients with carbs, proteins, and fats in appropriate proportions.
Avoid skipping meals to maintain steady energy levels.
